intro: Coelachyrum, commonly known as the common water-dropwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist or wet environments such as marshes and stream banks. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves and small white or greenish flowers that appear in umbels. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional medicine. Coelachyrum is characterized by its ability to thrive in waterlogged soils, making it an important indicator plant for wetland ecosystems.
